interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: Becoming Jane
Review Date: 2008/05/22
Store: Anne Hathaway  (Actor),     James McAvoy  (Actor),     Julian Jarrold  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Studio Specials, Miramax Home Entertainment, All Titles
Product Description: ['Anne Hathaway (The Devil Wears Prada, The Princess Diaries) gives a radiant performance as a young, love-struck Jane Austen in the witty and engaging romantic comedy Becoming Jane from Miramax Films. It s the untold romance that inspired the novels of one of the world s most celebrated authors. When the dashing Tom Lefroy (James McAvoy, The Last King Of Scotland), a reckless and penniless lawyer-to-be, enters Jane s life, he offends the emerging writer s sense and sensibility. Soon their clashing egos set off sparks that ignite a passionate romance and fuel Jane s dream of doing the unthinkable marrying for love. Becoming Jane, also starring the acclaimed Maggie Smith, James Cromwell and Julie Walters, is an enchanting and imaginative film you ll fall head over heels for']
Average Rating: 4.5
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Romance, Performing Arts', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Anne Hathaway, Julian Jarrold, James McAvoy', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Spanish (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0)', 'Runtime': '2 hours', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.35:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 3.2 Ounces', 'Director': 'Julian Jarrold', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, AC-3, Closed-captioned, Color, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours', 'Release date': 'February 12, 2008', 'Actors': 'Anne Hathaway, James McAvoy', 'Dubbed': 'Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'English, Spanish, French', 'Studio': 'Miramax', 'Number of discs': '1'}
Review Text: Becoming Jane is a wonderful movie.  Anne Hathaway shines as Jane and embodies her spirit perfectly.  The script is fun and flirty with plenty of wit and charm.  They work in many references to Jane Austen's novels.  James McAvoy makes me drool, he is sweet and sexy.  Altogether it is a charming movie, although the ending, if you know anything about her life, isn't exactly what you hope for.
Review Title: Fun and romantic
Rating: 5.0
--------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
The Talented Mr. Ripley
Matt Damon  (Actor),     Gwyneth Paltrow  (Actor),     Anthony Minghella  (Director, Writer)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    R    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Drama
["To be young and carefree amid the blue waters and idyllic landscape of sun-drenched Italy in the late 1950's; that's the life Tom Ripley, the con artist, craves, and Dickie Greenleaf, the rich playboy, leads. When Dickie's father, a wealthy industrialist, commissions Ripley to bring his son home to America, Dickie and his beautiful expatriate girlfriend never suspect the dangerous extremes to which Ripley will go to make their lifestyle his own."]
{'Genre': 'Feature', 'Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Philip Seymour Hoffman, Anthony Minghella, Matt Damon, Sergio Rubini, Cate Blanchett, Stefania Rocca, James Rebhorn, Philip Baker Hall, Fiorello, Patricia Highsmith, Jack Davenport, Celia Weston, Jude Law, Gwyneth PaltrowPhilip Seymour Hoffman, Anthony Minghella, Matt Damon, Sergio Rubini, Cate Blanchett, Stefania Rocca, James Rebhorn, Philip Baker Hall, Fiorello, Patricia Highsmith, Jack Davenport, Celia Weston, Jude Law, Gwyneth Paltrow   See more', 'Language': 'English (Dolby Digital 5.1), Unknown (Dolby Digital 5.1), English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround), French (Dolby Digital 2.0 Surround)', 'Runtime': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.85:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'R (Restricted)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.25 x 5.25 x 0.25 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'PARD331424D', 'Director': 'Anthony Minghella', 'Media Format': 'Anamorphic, Color, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Closed-captioned, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Run time': '2 hours and 19 minutes', 'Release date': 'June 27, 2000', 'Actors': 'Matt Damon, Gwyneth Paltrow, Jude Law, Cate Blanchett, Philip Seymour Hoffman', 'Dubbed': 'French', 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Studio': 'Paramount', 'Writers': 'Anthony Minghella, Patricia Highsmith', 'Number of discs': '1'}
One of my favorite movies.  Matt Damon's performance is perfect, Jude Law is wonderful and Gwyneth Paltrow is luminescent.  It is mysterious, haunting, and thought provoking.  The acting is intense and masterful and you cannot help but be drawn into the story.  The complex layers of the characters are slowly revealed and wonderfully portrayed.
Amazing performances
Penelope
Richard Grant  (Actor),     Catherine O'Hara  (Actor),     Mark Palansky  (Director)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    PG    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
['Born with the snout of a pig, young Penelope Wilhern (Christina Ricci) spends life a virtual prisoner in her home. Believing that the only way to break the curse is to marry one of her own kind, she meets a number of suitors, but all reject her. Two devious men, one with a grudge against the family, hire a man (James McAvoy) to pose as a suitor, but complications arise when he begins to fall in love with Penelope, and she makes a bid for freedom.']
{'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG (Parental Guidance Suggested)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.72 Ounces', 'Item model number': '6104618', 'Director': 'Mark Palansky', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Color, AC-3, Full Screen, NTSC, Subtitled, Dolby, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'July 15, 2008', 'Actors': "Richard Grant, Catherine O'Hara, Christina Ricci, Peter Dinklage, James McAvoy", 'Subtitles': 'English', 'Producers': 'Jennifer Simpson, Reese Witherspoon, Scott Steindorff', 'Studio': 'Lionsgate', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This was such a fun movie.  The tale is great and the acting is wonderful.  James McAvoy is so cute and sweet.  I really enjoyed the sets, especially Penelope's bedroom, it is full of magic and imagination.  Her wardrobe leaves me drooling as well.  This is an entertaining and fun movie and I've been waiting for it to be released on DVD ever since I saw it in the theater.
A wonderful fun movie

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

This user demonstrates a profound appreciation for cinematic artistry, particularly within the drama genre, favoring complex character development and compelling narratives. Recently, they've expanded their tastes to include whimsical storytelling and engaging performances in comedy, admiring actors who portray lighthearted yet meaningful characters. 

Their latest viewing experience showcases a commendation for romantic comedies that intertwine humor with emotional depth, suggesting an evolving palate that embraces a blend of narrative styles. The user still values intense emotional engagement but has shown an enjoyment for films that feature charming, witty scripts and imaginative aesthetics, including strong performances and clever references to literary works.

While their previous focus centered on thought-provoking themes, the current profile reflects a balanced interest in feel-good stories that provide both entertainment and a sense of artistry in set design and characterization. Their discerning eye for quality remains evident, as seen in their high ratings and enthusiastic reviews of films across genres. This user now enjoys exploring narratives that leave a lasting impact, blending emotionally resonant character-driven stories with lightheartedness, indicative of their dynamic appreciation for various facets of cinema.
